title: Make sure to also output session name and container name if they are not the same as main session uuid
body:
```
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % bun install -g start-command    
bun add v1.2.20 (6ad208bc)

installed start-command@0.19.0 with binaries:
 - $

[302.00ms] done
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % $ echo 'hi'                     
│ session   3098d3ae-07b2-418c-aede-c001b82ec31c
│ start     2026-01-08 02:57:23.530
│
$ echo hi

hi

✓
│ finish    2026-01-08 02:57:23.798
│ duration  0.268s
│ exit      0
│
│ log       /var/folders/cl/831lqjgd58v5mb_m74cfdfcw0000gn/T/start-command-1767841043530-kyf19v.log
│ session   3098d3ae-07b2-418c-aede-c001b82ec31c
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % $ --isolated screen -- echo 'hi'
│ session   a39a17a3-1064-480d-b508-80b8bdd3a93f
│ start     2026-01-08 02:57:28.115
│
│ isolation screen
│ mode      attached
│
$ echo hi

hi

✓
│ finish    2026-01-08 02:57:28.423
│ duration  0.415s
│ exit      0
│
│ isolation screen
│ mode      attached
│
│ log       /var/folders/cl/831lqjgd58v5mb_m74cfdfcw0000gn/T/start-command-screen-1767841048115-nch2wk.log
│ session   a39a17a3-1064-480d-b508-80b8bdd3a93f
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % $ --isolated docker -- echo 'hi'
│ session   f1efebcd-5426-437b-92db-b94acaaf421c
│ start     2026-01-08 02:57:31.864
│
│ isolation docker
│ mode      attached
│ image     alpine:latest
│
$ echo hi

hi

✓
│ finish    2026-01-08 02:57:32.241
│ duration  0.489s
│ exit      0
│
│ isolation docker
│ mode      attached
│ image     alpine:latest
│
│ log       /var/folders/cl/831lqjgd58v5mb_m74cfdfcw0000gn/T/start-command-docker-1767841051864-c0qs07.log
│ session   f1efebcd-5426-437b-92db-b94acaaf421c
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ %
```

If for screen, docker, tmux and so on the screen name is not the same as session UUID, we should output it separately, but if we can we should try to use the same UUID for screen name and docker name and so on. But if it is not possible we should make sure at start and end blocks we do display that info, so if for example we use detached mode, or attached mode without closing of screen/docker container we should be able to see all the data to reconnect to them.

Please download all logs and data related about the issue to this repository, make sure we compile that data to `./docs/case-studies/issue-{id}` folder, and use it to do deep case study analysis (also make sure to search online for additional facts and data), in which we will reconstruct timeline/sequence of events, find root causes of the problem, and propose possible solutions.
